Basal forebrain cholinergic neurons (BFCNs) are a group of brain cells that are important for attention, learning and memory functions. BFCNs receive input from a protein produced in the hippocampus, called nerve growth factor (NGF). NGF plays a vital role in the well-being of BFCNs.
